title: Missing preferences Drop Down Button and Yellow "To protect your privacy, Thunderbird has blocked .........." message
content:
Hi I've been using Thunderbird for years but a strange problem has appeared recently I can't pin down when exactly.

When I open an email I do not see any remote content but I also do not see the Yellow warning message "To protect your privacy, Thunderbird has blocked remote content in this message", nor the Preferences drop down menu button. See image.

In Settings I have Allow remote content in messages unchecked, see image.

The message body is set to Original HTML. See image.

When I click on the Original HTML that is already checked, I get the Yellow waning message etc. See Image

I have used troubleshoot mode to reset my toolbars and controls, I have no add-ons.

My wife also has the same problem on her laptop. We are both running version 102.8.0 (64-Bit) on Lubuntu 22.04 installed from the main repo.

I have searched the forums for a solution and the problem I have is normally due to one of the above settings being incorrect.

Is there anything I am missing?

Cheers Peter

title: Thunderbird frequently stops responding
content:
My computer has an AMD Ryzen 9 5900X CPU, 128 Gig of RAM and lots of M2.0 SSD Drive space. After an upgrade to Thunderbird a while ago it started to periodically stop responding for a minute or two or three. It is NOT related to any activity as it will also do this when it is sitting there and I am not interacting with it. I started watching the Task Manager Process view. I see no spike in network or disk activity but the CU usage jumps from less than 1% to close to 7% and memory usage ruins from 500 MB up to about 2,000MB then drops and builds up again. When CPU usage drops down the program resumes responding. It has started doing this very frequently so it is no longer just an annoyance it is making Thunderbird nearly useless. But I have been using Thunderbird for years and I really like it (except for this problem) so I don't want to give up on it.

I have tried everything I could find on this and any other site to resolve this or find the cause including the troubleshoot mode and nothing has helped.

As a last ditch effort I am considering an uninstall and re-install. Is there a way to do this without losing the contents of my inboxes and sent boxes. I would also like to preserve my email account settings.

Oh, BTW, total CPU usage is never over 10% (usually at 8%) and memory usage is never above 12% (usually closer to 8%) when this is happening, so my computer is way far from being over utilized by other processes.

Any help would be very appreciated. Don
creator: dkramber1

title: MS 365 Shared Mailboxes authentication is failing on 102.7.2
content: If you set up a shared MS 365 mailbox in Thunderbird, the oAuth credentials prompt does not allow you to change the username to the main authenticating username (the one with access to the shared mailbox), so one cannot authenticate for the shared mailbox. This started happening as of the 102.7.x versions and does not work either on 102.7.2. It works fine on 102.6.1. It seems the preset URL to the login.live.com site has parameters in it that preset the username (email address) and one cannot change it, making it impossible to authenticate. It's a proper bug. So not all is well yet with the MS 365 authentication.
creator: mark435

title: Setting Default Calendar for New Event?
content:
I've seen some answers to this question but they are either quite old or incomplete. Here's the simple answer (at least for TBird 102+ but maybe for earlier versions, too):

From the View menu, select Calendar>Calendar Pane>Show Calendar Pane; be sure it's now checked. Then, again from View>Calendar>Calendar Pane, enable Calendar List (so it's also checked). (The mini-calendar isn't required for this but, if you like to see it, that's fine.)

Now, in the Calendar list, drag the calendar you wish to be the default for new events to the top of the list.

That's it. Just works. No css nonsense nor anything in the advanced config screen.
creator: rumplestiltskin

Frustratingly I can see in SQLite Manager that the calendar entries are there in the local.sqlite file, but cant get them to appear in Tbird - neither by 'import profile', nor by just pasting local.sqlite into the calendar-data folder.

Help!!
